revised_title: Fibrin-yielding Constituents of Blood Plasma: A Study on Plasma Coagulation
tldr: The author investigates the fibrin-yielding constituents of blood plasma, specifically peptone plasma and NaCl plasma, and discovers that the majority of coagulable matter in these plasmas is not in the form of fibrinogen. Instead, it is a substance that must first be altered by dilution or other means to form fibrin.
